item.title: Is it possible to
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

I tried.

client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex]; if(p.connectedFrom == ("THEIR IP HERE")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "" +playerName+ " is Peter!"; }

But then I got this error…

client.java:9460: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable otherPIndex
location: class client
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
                                                 ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
Note: server.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Is it possible to
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

Is it possible to identify someone by their IP when they log in? For example, when someone logs in it says “yay bla bla has logged in!” and the code for that would be:

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("bla bla")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "yay" +playerName+ " has logged in!"; }

So what if I wanted it to identify someone by their IP so no matter what account they log on, it still says it’s them. say this person’s name was Peter:

if(p.connectedFrom == ("THEIR IP HERE")) { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "" +playerName+ " is Peter!"; }

You get what I’m trying to do? well anyways I tried that and I got a could not find symbol on the

p.conectedFrom ^
part. Please don’t post if what you’re going to say isn’t going to help me in any way.
Thanks

Read full topic
